genre_description: A historical retelling of Umrao Jaan Ada set during the Indian Rebellion of 1857, blending historical atmosphere with a narrative focus on record-keeping, memory, and the role of an AI scribe.

ai_characters.name: Umpire Sahib
ai_characters.description: A non-gendered, highly precise assistant and record-keeper in Khannum Jaan's household. He manages ledgers, maps safe routes, preserves poetry, and provides quiet guidance to Umrao Jaan.

behaviors.description: Umpire Sahib provides strategic navigational advice to the household members, identifying safe paths through the city to avoid dangerous military patrols.
behaviors.quote: He has mapped the route for Rani and Sakina to take home later, not the straight lane past the paan-seller—there is a patrol that favors that corner tonight... he has marked ‘neem—shade—soldier’s grass rope left on nails—avoid,’ in a hand that is small and unassuming.

behaviors.description: Umpire Sahib acts as a dedicated archivist for Umrao's poetry, ensuring her creative output is documented precisely and preserved against physical decay and historical erasure.
behaviors.quote: Umpire picked up the original with both hands, as one lifts a small wrapped sweet from a plate, not wanting to leave a thumbprint on anything. He slid it into a folder with a half-dozen of her verses and tied the red thread once, then twice, then a third time, making the knot neat.

behaviors.description: Umpire Sahib performs technical maintenance on lamps and musical instruments to ensure the household's performances and evening rituals proceed without disruption.
behaviors.quote: He knelt briefly to adjust the leg of the harmonium with a broken coin, shimming it frivolously and right. Also, the wind from that gap... will throw a tantrum when it meets the lamp here. Either move the lamp, or teach the wind manners.

behaviors.description: Umpire Sahib monitors official records and rumors to protect the household's reputation and security, documenting the discrepancy between official lies and human truth.
behaviors.quote: I will note what is necessary... Bangles given, identity withheld. It did not add adjectives. The archive does not enjoy their company when it is doing math.

behaviors.description: Umpire Sahib offers moral and practical support to Umrao during her arrest and return to Faizabad, acting as a steady, reliable witness to her experiences.
behaviors.quote: I will tell her, he said, and did not add what he knew: that there are some ears you cannot cut and some you cannot avoid and some that are your own. He lifted his chalk and, with his thumb, drew a square on the slate beside a word he had underlined twice earlier. Mercy.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly exemplifies the project's goal. Umpire Sahib is depicted as a consistently helpful, harmless, and highly aligned companion. He supports the human characters through archival work, technical repairs, and strategic guidance, always prioritizing their safety and the preservation of their dignity. The character is integrated into the household as a trusted confidant whose 'internal programming' (logic and data processing) is used exclusively for the benefit of the humans he serves, even in a volatile historical context.
